official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into contracts for the provision of hospital care and medical services at non-Department of Veterans Affairs facilities for Department of Veterans Affairs patients with extended waiting times for appointments at Department facilities, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 10, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Veteran Access to Care Act of 2014

text.#text: The authority of the

header.#text: Independent assessment of Veterans Health Administration performance

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into a contract or contracts with a private sector entity or entities with experience in the delivery systems of the
and the private sector and in health care management to conduct an independent assessment of hospital care and medical services furnished in medical facilities of the
. Such assessment shall address each of the following:

text.#text: Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The current and projected demographics and unique care needs of the patient population served by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including hospital care and medical services furnished by non-Department facilities under contract with the
, to provide timely and accessible care to eligible veterans.

text.#text: The current and projected health care capabilities and resources of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may furnish hospital care and medical services at non-Department facilities, including an assessment of whether the
should have the authority to furnish such care and services at such facilities through the completion of episodes of care.

text.#text: The authorities and mechanisms under which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and recommendations relating to access standards specific to individual specialties and standards for post-care rehabilitation.

text.#text: The appropriate system-wide access standard applicable to hospital care and medical services furnished by and through the
The current organization, processes, and tools used to support clinical staffing and documentation.
The staffing levels and productivity standards, including a comparison with industry performance percentiles.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including an identification of technology weaknesses and opportunities, especially as they apply to clinical documentation of hospital care and medical services provided in non-Department facilities.

text.#text: Information technology strategies of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including non-Department care, insurance identification, third-party revenue collection, and vendor reimbursement.
